headline: How Investors Are Reacting To S&P Global (SPGI) Dividend Hike And Mobility Spin-Off Plan
summary: In January 2026, S&P Global’s Board approved a 1.0% increase in its regular quarterly cash dividend to US$0.97 per share, payable on March 11, 2026, bringing the new annualized rate to US$3.88 as the company prepares to spin off its Mobility division. This modest dividend raise, paired with S&P Global’s influential data on accelerating AI and cloud infrastructure spending, underscores how the firm’s role as both information provider and income payer can shape investor perceptions of its...

headline: Will Nasdaq's Beat Streak Continue This Earnings Season?
summary: NDAQ's Q4 results are likely to reflect higher subscription revenues, new listings, higher trade management services business and new client contracts.

headline: Stocks overachieved in 2025. Will the party end in 2026?
summary: As recently as last June, forecasters expected a flat 2025 for stocks. Instead, the S&P gained more than 16%. What's coming in 2026?
